docs.snippet: JOSEPH L. WHITE has been assassinated! A sad and mournful sentence that will blanch the cheek of many who only knew him as a friend, and fall with crashing weight upon the hearts of loved ones who will never see him more!

headline.main: LAW REPORTS.; MAYOR WOOD PRESENTED BY THE GRAND JURY. Court of General Sessions. HEAVY SENTENCE FOR ARSON A TERRIBLE WARNING TO OTHERS. Court of Oyer amnd Terminer. A Lawyer Charged with Defrauding his Client. SUPREME COURT CIRCUIT. Before Justice Sutherland. Affairs of a Collapsed Railroad Company A Scramble for the Spoils. SUPREME COURT CHAMBERS. Before Justice Bernard. Decisions. POLICE REPORTS. PERSONAL. Annual Report of the Health Officer of Brooklyn. Division of the Territories.

docs.lead_paragraph: In this Court yesterday, before Judge McCUNN, Jacob Miller, convicted on the previous day of arson in the second degree, was sentenced to Sing Sing for twelve years and three months. The prisoner complained that his counsel had forced him to an immature trial, and he asked for a new one, on the ground that he could prove, upon the testimony of fifteen respectable citizens, that he was elsewhere on the night of the fire.
